channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023120505
item.description:
Report X-2023120505

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: MONROE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was reported to be leaking by UPRR train crew personnel when they coupled into the car. Mgr. of Hazardous Materials Tom Robinson was called for a response. The tank car was found to have one man way swing bolt tightened down harder than the others causing the man way lid to be slightly cocked open. The man way lid was properly secured, and the car was moved back and forth to assure it was properly secured. Mgr. Robinson documented the new seal numbers, and the car was allowed to continue in transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023120680
item.description:
Report X-2023120680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: CARENCRO
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to Nonconveyable roller on Belt 1. Package was put on roller and powder fell from corners of box. Package was brought to QA Processing area. DescribePack: Upon inspection plastic drum was found to be damaged. Bottom of plastic drum is broken and powder spilled out into box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken out of sortation and placed in QA processing area. Package was placed inside blue hazmat bag inside hazmat drummed and processed.
